item.title: Combining Stack Overflow RSS, OData and API to query
item.description: In my opinion Stack Overflow has a ton of knowledge to learn new tricks. And there are some really smart people in the SO community. I try and learn new things when I find time. I subscribe to RSS feeds for new questions on a particular topic. Example, here is one for F# from Stack Overflow http://stackoverflow.com/feeds/tag/f%23. The advantage of the RSS feed is I get to see new questions, but the drawback is I would have to navigate to the site to look for answers.

item.title: Using Tech-Ed OData to download videos
item.description: I wanted to watch the Teched 2010 videos, but the problem I had was going to the site manually to download files for offline viewing. And I was also interested only in Dev sessions which were level 300 / 400. Thanks to OData for teched http://odata.msteched.com/sessions.svc/ ,I could write 3 statements in linqpad and had them all downloaded using wget [sourcecode language=”csharp”] File.Delete(@“C:tempdownload.txt”); Sessions .Where (s => (s.Level.StartsWith(“400”) || s.Level.StartsWith(“300”) ) && s.
